44 class ColumnDescriptor;
45 
46 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
47 // Encoding::PLAIN decoder implementation
48 
49 template <typename DType>
50 class PlainDecoder : public Decoder<DType> {
51  public:
52  typedef typename DType::c_type T;
53  using Decoder<DType>::num_values_;
54 
55  explicit PlainDecoder(const ColumnDescriptor* descr)
56  : Decoder<DType>(descr, Encoding::PLAIN), data_(nullptr), len_(0) {
57  if (descr_ && descr_->physical_type() == Type::FIXED_LEN_BYTE_ARRAY) {
58  type_length_ = descr_->type_length();
59  } else {
60  type_length_ = -1;
61  }
62  }
63 
64  virtual void SetData(int num_values, const uint8_t* data, int len) {
65  num_values_ = num_values;
66  data_ = data;
67  len_ = len;
68  }
69 
70  virtual int Decode(T* buffer, int max_values);
71 
72  private:
73  using Decoder<DType>::descr_;
74  const uint8_t* data_;
75  int len_;
76  int type_length_;
77 };
78 
79 // Decode routine templated on C++ type rather than type enum
80 template <typename T>
81 inline int DecodePlain(const uint8_t* data, int64_t data_size, int num_values,
82  int type_length, T* out) {
83  int bytes_to_decode = num_values * static_cast<int>(sizeof(T));
84  if (data_size < bytes_to_decode) {
85  ParquetException::EofException();
86  }
87  memcpy(out, data, bytes_to_decode);
88  return bytes_to_decode;
89 }
90 
91 // Template specialization for BYTE_ARRAY. The written values do not own their
92 // own data.
93 template <>
94 inline int DecodePlain<ByteArray>(const uint8_t* data, int64_t data_size, int num_values,
95  int type_length, ByteArray* out) {
96  int bytes_decoded = 0;
97  int increment;
98  for (int i = 0; i < num_values; ++i) {
99  uint32_t len = out[i].len = *reinterpret_cast<const uint32_t*>(data);
100  increment = static_cast<int>(sizeof(uint32_t) + len);
101  if (data_size < increment) ParquetException::EofException();
102  out[i].ptr = data + sizeof(uint32_t);
103  data += increment;
104  data_size -= increment;
105  bytes_decoded += increment;
106  }
107  return bytes_decoded;
108 }
109 
110 // Template specialization for FIXED_LEN_BYTE_ARRAY. The written values do not
111 // own their own data.
112 template <>
113 inline int DecodePlain<FixedLenByteArray>(const uint8_t* data, int64_t data_size,
114  int num_values, int type_length,
115  FixedLenByteArray* out) {
116  int bytes_to_decode = type_length * num_values;
117  if (data_size < bytes_to_decode) {
118  ParquetException::EofException();
119  }
120  for (int i = 0; i < num_values; ++i) {
121  out[i].ptr = data;
122  data += type_length;
123  data_size -= type_length;
124  }
125  return bytes_to_decode;
126 }
127 
128 template <typename DType>
129 inline int PlainDecoder<DType>::Decode(T* buffer, int max_values) {
130  max_values = std::min(max_values, num_values_);
131  int bytes_consumed = DecodePlain<T>(data_, len_, max_values, type_length_, buffer);
132  data_ += bytes_consumed;
133  len_ -= bytes_consumed;
134  num_values_ -= max_values;
135  return max_values;
136 }
137 
138 template <>
139 class PlainDecoder<BooleanType> : public Decoder<BooleanType> {
140  public:
141  explicit PlainDecoder(const ColumnDescriptor* descr)
142  : Decoder<BooleanType>(descr, Encoding::PLAIN) {}
143 
144  virtual void SetData(int num_values, const uint8_t* data, int len) {
145  num_values_ = num_values;
146  bit_reader_ = BitUtil::BitReader(data, len);
147  }
148 
149  // Two flavors of bool decoding
150  int Decode(uint8_t* buffer, int max_values) {
151  max_values = std::min(max_values, num_values_);
152  bool val;
153  ::arrow::internal::BitmapWriter bit_writer(buffer, 0, max_values);
154  for (int i = 0; i < max_values; ++i) {
155  if (!bit_reader_.GetValue(1, &val)) {
156  ParquetException::EofException();
157  }
158  if (val) {
159  bit_writer.Set();
160  }
161  bit_writer.Next();
162  }
163  bit_writer.Finish();
164  num_values_ -= max_values;
165  return max_values;
166  }
167 
168  virtual int Decode(bool* buffer, int max_values) {
169  max_values = std::min(max_values, num_values_);
170  if (bit_reader_.GetBatch(1, buffer, max_values) != max_values) {
171  ParquetException::EofException();
172  }
173  num_values_ -= max_values;
174  return max_values;
175  }
176 
177  private:
178  BitUtil::BitReader bit_reader_;
179 };
180 
181 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
182 // Encoding::PLAIN encoder implementation
183 
184 template <typename DType>
185 class PlainEncoder : public Encoder<DType> {
186  public:
187  typedef typename DType::c_type T;
188 
189  explicit PlainEncoder(const ColumnDescriptor* descr,
190  ::arrow::MemoryPool* pool = ::arrow::default_memory_pool())
191  : Encoder<DType>(descr, Encoding::PLAIN, pool) {
192  values_sink_.reset(new InMemoryOutputStream(pool));
193  }
194 
195  int64_t EstimatedDataEncodedSize() override { return values_sink_->Tell(); }
196 
197  std::shared_ptr<Buffer> FlushValues() override;
198  void Put(const T* src, int num_values) override;
199 
200  protected:
201  std::unique_ptr<InMemoryOutputStream> values_sink_;
202 };
203 
204 template <>
205 class PlainEncoder<BooleanType> : public Encoder<BooleanType> {
206  public:
207  explicit PlainEncoder(const ColumnDescriptor* descr,
208  ::arrow::MemoryPool* pool = ::arrow::default_memory_pool())
209  : Encoder<BooleanType>(descr, Encoding::PLAIN, pool),
210  bits_available_(kInMemoryDefaultCapacity * 8),
211  bits_buffer_(AllocateBuffer(pool, kInMemoryDefaultCapacity)),
212  values_sink_(new InMemoryOutputStream(pool)) {
213  bit_writer_.reset(new BitUtil::BitWriter(bits_buffer_->mutable_data(),
214  static_cast<int>(bits_buffer_->size())));
215  }
216 
217  int64_t EstimatedDataEncodedSize() override {
218  return values_sink_->Tell() + bit_writer_->bytes_written();
219  }
220 
221  std::shared_ptr<Buffer> FlushValues() override {
222  if (bits_available_ > 0) {
223  bit_writer_->Flush();
224  values_sink_->Write(bit_writer_->buffer(), bit_writer_->bytes_written());
225  bit_writer_->Clear();
226  bits_available_ = static_cast<int>(bits_buffer_->size()) * 8;
227  }
228 
229  std::shared_ptr<Buffer> buffer = values_sink_->GetBuffer();
230  values_sink_.reset(new InMemoryOutputStream(this->pool_));
231  return buffer;
232  }
233 
234 #define PLAINDECODER_BOOLEAN_PUT(input_type, function_attributes) \
235  void Put(input_type src, int num_values) function_attributes { \
236  int bit_offset = 0; \
237  if (bits_available_ > 0) { \
238  int bits_to_write = std::min(bits_available_, num_values); \
239  for (int i = 0; i < bits_to_write; i++) { \
240  bit_writer_->PutValue(src[i], 1); \
241  } \
242  bits_available_ -= bits_to_write; \
243  bit_offset = bits_to_write; \
244  \
245  if (bits_available_ == 0) { \
246  bit_writer_->Flush(); \
247  values_sink_->Write(bit_writer_->buffer(), bit_writer_->bytes_written()); \
248  bit_writer_->Clear(); \
249  } \
250  } \
251  \
252  int bits_remaining = num_values - bit_offset; \
253  while (bit_offset < num_values) { \
254  bits_available_ = static_cast<int>(bits_buffer_->size()) * 8; \
255  \
256  int bits_to_write = std::min(bits_available_, bits_remaining); \
257  for (int i = bit_offset; i < bit_offset + bits_to_write; i++) { \
258  bit_writer_->PutValue(src[i], 1); \
259  } \
260  bit_offset += bits_to_write; \
261  bits_available_ -= bits_to_write; \
262  bits_remaining -= bits_to_write; \
263  \
264  if (bits_available_ == 0) { \
265  bit_writer_->Flush(); \
266  values_sink_->Write(bit_writer_->buffer(), bit_writer_->bytes_written()); \
267  bit_writer_->Clear(); \
268  } \
269  } \
270  }
271 
272  PLAINDECODER_BOOLEAN_PUT(const bool*, override)
273  PLAINDECODER_BOOLEAN_PUT(const std::vector<bool>&, )
274 
275  protected:
276  int bits_available_;
277  std::unique_ptr<BitUtil::BitWriter> bit_writer_;
278  std::shared_ptr<ResizableBuffer> bits_buffer_;
279  std::unique_ptr<InMemoryOutputStream> values_sink_;
280 };
281 
282 template <typename DType>
283 inline std::shared_ptr<Buffer> PlainEncoder<DType>::FlushValues() {
284  std::shared_ptr<Buffer> buffer = values_sink_->GetBuffer();
285  values_sink_.reset(new InMemoryOutputStream(this->pool_));
286  return buffer;
287 }
288 
289 template <typename DType>
290 inline void PlainEncoder<DType>::Put(const T* buffer, int num_values) {
291  values_sink_->Write(reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*>(buffer), num_values * sizeof(T));
292 }
293 
294 template <>
295 inline void PlainEncoder<ByteArrayType>::Put(const ByteArray* src, int num_values) {
296  for (int i = 0; i < num_values; ++i) {
297  // Write the result to the output stream
298  values_sink_->Write(reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*>(&src[i].len), sizeof(uint32_t));
299  if (src[i].len > 0) {
300  DCHECK(nullptr != src[i].ptr) << "Value ptr cannot be NULL";
301  }
302  values_sink_->Write(reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*>(src[i].ptr), src[i].len);
303  }
304 }
305 
306 template <>
307 inline void PlainEncoder<FLBAType>::Put(const FixedLenByteArray* src, int num_values) {
308  for (int i = 0; i < num_values; ++i) {
309  // Write the result to the output stream
310  if (descr_->type_length() > 0) {
311  DCHECK(nullptr != src[i].ptr) << "Value ptr cannot be NULL";
312  }
313  values_sink_->Write(reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*>(src[i].ptr),
314  descr_->type_length());
315  }
316 }
317 
318 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
319 // Dictionary encoding and decoding
320 
321 template <typename Type>
322 class DictionaryDecoder : public Decoder<Type> {
323  public:
324  typedef typename Type::c_type T;
325 
326  // Initializes the dictionary with values from 'dictionary'. The data in
327  // dictionary is not guaranteed to persist in memory after this call so the
328  // dictionary decoder needs to copy the data out if necessary.
329  explicit DictionaryDecoder(const ColumnDescriptor* descr,
330  ::arrow::MemoryPool* pool = ::arrow::default_memory_pool())
331  : Decoder<Type>(descr, Encoding::RLE_DICTIONARY),
332  dictionary_(0, pool),
333  byte_array_data_(AllocateBuffer(pool, 0)) {}
334 
335  // Perform type-specific initiatialization
336  void SetDict(Decoder<Type>* dictionary);
337 
338  void SetData(int num_values, const uint8_t* data, int len) override {
339  num_values_ = num_values;
340  if (len == 0) return;
341  uint8_t bit_width = *data;
342  ++data;
343  --len;
344  idx_decoder_ = ::arrow::util::RleDecoder(data, len, bit_width);
345  }
346 
347  int Decode(T* buffer, int max_values) override {
348  max_values = std::min(max_values, num_values_);
349  int decoded_values =
350  idx_decoder_.GetBatchWithDict(dictionary_.data(), buffer, max_values);
351  if (decoded_values != max_values) {
352  ParquetException::EofException();
353  }
354  num_values_ -= max_values;
355  return max_values;
356  }
357 
358  int DecodeSpaced(T* buffer, int num_values, int null_count, const uint8_t* valid_bits,
359  int64_t valid_bits_offset) override {
360  int decoded_values =
361  idx_decoder_.GetBatchWithDictSpaced(dictionary_.data(), buffer, num_values,
362  null_count, valid_bits, valid_bits_offset);
363  if (decoded_values != num_values) {
364  ParquetException::EofException();
365  }
366  return decoded_values;
367  }
368 
369  private:
370  using Decoder<Type>::num_values_;
371 
372  // Only one is set.
373  Vector<T> dictionary_;
374 
375  // Data that contains the byte array data (byte_array_dictionary_ just has the
376  // pointers).
377  std::shared_ptr<ResizableBuffer> byte_array_data_;
378 
379  ::arrow::util::RleDecoder idx_decoder_;
380 };
381 
382 template <typename Type>
383 inline void DictionaryDecoder<Type>::SetDict(Decoder<Type>* dictionary) {
384  int num_dictionary_values = dictionary->values_left();
385  dictionary_.Resize(num_dictionary_values);
386  dictionary->Decode(&dictionary_[0], num_dictionary_values);
387 }
388 
389 template <>
390 inline void DictionaryDecoder<BooleanType>::SetDict(Decoder<BooleanType>* dictionary) {
391  ParquetException::NYI("Dictionary encoding is not implemented for boolean values");
392 }
393 
394 template <>
395 inline void DictionaryDecoder<ByteArrayType>::SetDict(
396  Decoder<ByteArrayType>* dictionary) {
397  int num_dictionary_values = dictionary->values_left();
398  dictionary_.Resize(num_dictionary_values);
399  dictionary->Decode(&dictionary_[0], num_dictionary_values);
400 
401  int total_size = 0;
402  for (int i = 0; i < num_dictionary_values; ++i) {
403  total_size += dictionary_[i].len;
404  }
405  if (total_size > 0) {
406  PARQUET_THROW_NOT_OK(byte_array_data_->Resize(total_size, false));
407  }
408 
409  int offset = 0;
410  uint8_t* bytes_data = byte_array_data_->mutable_data();
411  for (int i = 0; i < num_dictionary_values; ++i) {
412  memcpy(bytes_data + offset, dictionary_[i].ptr, dictionary_[i].len);
413  dictionary_[i].ptr = bytes_data + offset;
414  offset += dictionary_[i].len;
415  }
416 }
417 
418 template <>
419 inline void DictionaryDecoder<FLBAType>::SetDict(Decoder<FLBAType>* dictionary) {
420  int num_dictionary_values = dictionary->values_left();
421  dictionary_.Resize(num_dictionary_values);
422  dictionary->Decode(&dictionary_[0], num_dictionary_values);
423 
424  int fixed_len = descr_->type_length();
425  int total_size = num_dictionary_values * fixed_len;
426 
427  PARQUET_THROW_NOT_OK(byte_array_data_->Resize(total_size, false));
428  uint8_t* bytes_data = byte_array_data_->mutable_data();
429  for (int32_t i = 0, offset = 0; i < num_dictionary_values; ++i, offset += fixed_len) {
430  memcpy(bytes_data + offset, dictionary_[i].ptr, fixed_len);
431  dictionary_[i].ptr = bytes_data + offset;
432  }
433 }
434 
435 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
436 // Dictionary encoder
437 
438 // Initially imported from Apache Impala on 2016-02-22, and has been modified
439 // since for parquet-cpp
440 
441 // Initially 1024 elements
442 static constexpr int INITIAL_HASH_TABLE_SIZE = 1 << 10;
443 
444 typedef int32_t hash_slot_t;
445 static constexpr hash_slot_t HASH_SLOT_EMPTY = std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::max();
446 
447 // The maximum load factor for the hash table before resizing.
448 static constexpr double MAX_HASH_LOAD = 0.7;
449 
455 template <typename DType>
456 class DictEncoder : public Encoder<DType> {
457  public:
458  typedef typename DType::c_type T;
459 
460  explicit DictEncoder(const ColumnDescriptor* desc, ChunkedAllocator* pool = nullptr,
461  ::arrow::MemoryPool* allocator = ::arrow::default_memory_pool())
462  : Encoder<DType>(desc, Encoding::PLAIN_DICTIONARY, allocator),
463  allocator_(allocator),
464  pool_(pool),
465  hash_table_size_(INITIAL_HASH_TABLE_SIZE),
466  mod_bitmask_(hash_table_size_ - 1),
467  hash_slots_(0, allocator),
468  dict_encoded_size_(0),
469  type_length_(desc->type_length()) {
470  hash_slots_.Assign(hash_table_size_, HASH_SLOT_EMPTY);
471  cpu_info_ = ::arrow::internal::CpuInfo::GetInstance();
472  }
473 
474  ~DictEncoder() override { DCHECK(buffered_indices_.empty()); }
475 
476  // TODO(wesm): think about how to address the construction semantics in
477  // encodings/dictionary-encoding.h
478  void set_mem_pool(ChunkedAllocator* pool) { pool_ = pool; }
479 
480  void set_type_length(int type_length) { type_length_ = type_length; }
481 
484  int64_t EstimatedDataEncodedSize() override {
485  // Note: because of the way RleEncoder::CheckBufferFull() is called, we have to
486  // reserve
487  // an extra "RleEncoder::MinBufferSize" bytes. These extra bytes won't be used
488  // but not reserving them would cause the encoder to fail.
489  return 1 +
490  ::arrow::util::RleEncoder::MaxBufferSize(
491  bit_width(), static_cast<int>(buffered_indices_.size())) +
492  ::arrow::util::RleEncoder::MinBufferSize(bit_width());
493  }
494 
496  int bit_width() const {
497  if (ARROW_PREDICT_FALSE(num_entries() == 0)) return 0;
498  if (ARROW_PREDICT_FALSE(num_entries() == 1)) return 1;
499  return BitUtil::Log2(num_entries());
500  }
501 
507  int WriteIndices(uint8_t* buffer, int buffer_len);
508 
509  int hash_table_size() { return hash_table_size_; }
510  int dict_encoded_size() { return dict_encoded_size_; }
512  void ClearIndices() { buffered_indices_.clear(); }
513 
516  template <bool use_sse42>
517  void Put(const T& value);
518 
519  template <bool use_sse42>
520  int Hash(const T& value);
521 
522  std::shared_ptr<Buffer> FlushValues() override {
523  std::shared_ptr<ResizableBuffer> buffer =
524  AllocateBuffer(this->allocator_, EstimatedDataEncodedSize());
525  int result_size = WriteIndices(buffer->mutable_data(),
526  static_cast<int>(EstimatedDataEncodedSize()));
527  ClearIndices();
528  PARQUET_THROW_NOT_OK(buffer->Resize(result_size, false));
529  return buffer;
530  }
531 
532  void Put(const T* values, int num_values) override {
533  if (cpu_info_->CanUseSSE4_2()) {
534  for (int i = 0; i < num_values; i++) {
535  Put<true>(values[i]);
536  }
537  } else {
538  for (int i = 0; i < num_values; i++) {
539  Put<false>(values[i]);
540  }
541  }
542  }
543 
544  template <bool use_sse42>
545  void DoubleTableSize();
546 
547  void PutSpaced(const T* src, int num_values, const uint8_t* valid_bits,
548  int64_t valid_bits_offset) override {
549  ::arrow::internal::BitmapReader valid_bits_reader(valid_bits, valid_bits_offset,
550  num_values);
551  if (cpu_info_->CanUseSSE4_2()) {
552  for (int32_t i = 0; i < num_values; i++) {
553  if (valid_bits_reader.IsSet()) {
554  Put<true>(src[i]);
555  }
556  valid_bits_reader.Next();
557  }
558  } else {
559  for (int32_t i = 0; i < num_values; i++) {
560  if (valid_bits_reader.IsSet()) {
561  Put<false>(src[i]);
562  }
563  valid_bits_reader.Next();
564  }
565  }
566  }
567 
570  void WriteDict(uint8_t* buffer);
571 
572  ChunkedAllocator* mem_pool() { return pool_; }
573 
575  int num_entries() const { return static_cast<int>(uniques_.size()); }
576 
577  private:
578  ::arrow::MemoryPool* allocator_;
579 
580  // For ByteArray / FixedLenByteArray data. Not owned
581  ChunkedAllocator* pool_;
582 
583  ::arrow::internal::CpuInfo* cpu_info_;
584 
586  int hash_table_size_;
587 
588  // Store hash_table_size_ - 1, so that j & mod_bitmask_ is equivalent to j %
589  // hash_table_size_, but uses far fewer CPU cycles
590  int mod_bitmask_;
591 
592  // We use a fixed-size hash table with linear probing
593  //
594  // These values correspond to the uniques_ array
595  Vector<hash_slot_t> hash_slots_;
596 
598  std::vector<int> buffered_indices_;
599 
601  int dict_encoded_size_;
602 
603  // The unique observed values
604  std::vector<T> uniques_;
605 
606  bool SlotDifferent(const T& v, hash_slot_t slot);
607 
609  int type_length_;
610 
612  void AddDictKey(const T& value);
613 };
614 
615 template <typename DType>
616 template <bool use_sse42>
617 int DictEncoder<DType>::Hash(const typename DType::c_type& value) {
618  return ::arrow::HashUtil::Hash<use_sse42>(&value, sizeof(value), 0);
619 }
620 
621 template <>
622 template <bool use_sse42>
623 int DictEncoder<ByteArrayType>::Hash(const ByteArray& value) {
624  if (value.len > 0) {
625  DCHECK_NE(nullptr, value.ptr) << "Value ptr cannot be NULL";
626  }
627  return ::arrow::HashUtil::Hash<use_sse42>(value.ptr, value.len, 0);
628 }
629 
630 template <>
631 template <bool use_sse42>
632 int DictEncoder<FLBAType>::Hash(const FixedLenByteArray& value) {
633  if (type_length_ > 0) {
634  DCHECK_NE(nullptr, value.ptr) << "Value ptr cannot be NULL";
635  }
636  return ::arrow::HashUtil::Hash<use_sse42>(value.ptr, type_length_, 0);
637 }
638 
639 template <typename DType>
640 inline bool DictEncoder<DType>::SlotDifferent(const typename DType::c_type& v,
641  hash_slot_t slot) {
642  return v != uniques_[slot];
643 }
644 
645 template <>
646 inline bool DictEncoder<FLBAType>::SlotDifferent(const FixedLenByteArray& v,
647  hash_slot_t slot) {
648  return 0 != memcmp(v.ptr, uniques_[slot].ptr, type_length_);
649 }
650 
651 template <typename DType>
652 template <bool use_sse42>
653 inline void DictEncoder<DType>::Put(const typename DType::c_type& v) {
654  int j = Hash<use_sse42>(v) & mod_bitmask_;
655  hash_slot_t index = hash_slots_[j];
656 
657  // Find an empty slot
658  while (HASH_SLOT_EMPTY != index && SlotDifferent(v, index)) {
659  // Linear probing
660  ++j;
661  if (j == hash_table_size_) j = 0;
662  index = hash_slots_[j];
663  }
664 
665  if (index == HASH_SLOT_EMPTY) {
666  // Not in the hash table, so we insert it now
667  index = static_cast<hash_slot_t>(uniques_.size());
668  hash_slots_[j] = index;
669  AddDictKey(v);
670 
671  if (ARROW_PREDICT_FALSE(static_cast<int>(uniques_.size()) >
672  hash_table_size_ * MAX_HASH_LOAD)) {
673  DoubleTableSize<use_sse42>();
674  }
675  }
676 
677  buffered_indices_.push_back(index);
678 }
679 
680 template <typename DType>
681 template <bool use_sse42>
682 inline void DictEncoder<DType>::DoubleTableSize() {
683  int new_size = hash_table_size_ * 2;
684  Vector<hash_slot_t> new_hash_slots(0, allocator_);
685  new_hash_slots.Assign(new_size, HASH_SLOT_EMPTY);
686  hash_slot_t index, slot;
687  int j;
688  for (int i = 0; i < hash_table_size_; ++i) {
689  index = hash_slots_[i];
690 
691  if (index == HASH_SLOT_EMPTY) {
692  continue;
693  }
694 
695  // Compute the hash value mod the new table size to start looking for an
696  // empty slot
697  const typename DType::c_type& v = uniques_[index];
698 
699  // Find an empty slot in the new hash table
700  j = Hash<use_sse42>(v) & (new_size - 1);
701  slot = new_hash_slots[j];
702  while (HASH_SLOT_EMPTY != slot && SlotDifferent(v, slot)) {
703  ++j;
704  if (j == new_size) j = 0;
705  slot = new_hash_slots[j];
706  }
707 
708  // Copy the old slot index to the new hash table
709  new_hash_slots[j] = index;
710  }
711 
712  hash_table_size_ = new_size;
713  mod_bitmask_ = new_size - 1;
714 
715  hash_slots_.Swap(new_hash_slots);
716 }
717 
718 template <typename DType>
719 inline void DictEncoder<DType>::AddDictKey(const typename DType::c_type& v) {
720  uniques_.push_back(v);
721  dict_encoded_size_ += static_cast<int>(sizeof(typename DType::c_type));
722 }
723 
724 template <>
725 inline void DictEncoder<ByteArrayType>::AddDictKey(const ByteArray& v) {
726  uint8_t* heap = pool_->Allocate(v.len);
727  if (ARROW_PREDICT_FALSE(v.len > 0 && heap == nullptr)) {
728  throw ParquetException("out of memory");
729  }
730  memcpy(heap, v.ptr, v.len);
731  uniques_.push_back(ByteArray(v.len, heap));
732  dict_encoded_size_ += static_cast<int>(v.len + sizeof(uint32_t));
733 }
734 
735 template <>
736 inline void DictEncoder<FLBAType>::AddDictKey(const FixedLenByteArray& v) {
737  uint8_t* heap = pool_->Allocate(type_length_);
738  if (ARROW_PREDICT_FALSE(type_length_ > 0 && heap == nullptr)) {
739  throw ParquetException("out of memory");
740  }
741  memcpy(heap, v.ptr, type_length_);
742 
743  uniques_.push_back(FixedLenByteArray(heap));
744  dict_encoded_size_ += type_length_;
745 }
746 
747 template <typename DType>
748 inline void DictEncoder<DType>::WriteDict(uint8_t* buffer) {
749  // For primitive types, only a memcpy
750  memcpy(buffer, uniques_.data(), sizeof(typename DType::c_type) * uniques_.size());
751 }
752 
753 template <>
754 inline void DictEncoder<BooleanType>::WriteDict(uint8_t* buffer) {
755  // For primitive types, only a memcpy
756  // memcpy(buffer, uniques_.data(), sizeof(typename DType::c_type) * uniques_.size());
757  for (size_t i = 0; i < uniques_.size(); i++) {
758  buffer[i] = uniques_[i];
759  }
760 }
761 
762 // ByteArray and FLBA already have the dictionary encoded in their data heaps
763 template <>
764 inline void DictEncoder<ByteArrayType>::WriteDict(uint8_t* buffer) {
765  for (const ByteArray& v : uniques_) {
766  memcpy(buffer, reinterpret_cast<const void*>(&v.len), sizeof(uint32_t));
767  buffer += sizeof(uint32_t);
768  if (v.len > 0) {
769  DCHECK(nullptr != v.ptr) << "Value ptr cannot be NULL";
770  }
771  memcpy(buffer, v.ptr, v.len);
772  buffer += v.len;
773  }
774 }
775 
776 template <>
777 inline void DictEncoder<FLBAType>::WriteDict(uint8_t* buffer) {
778  for (const FixedLenByteArray& v : uniques_) {
779  if (type_length_ > 0) {
780  DCHECK(nullptr != v.ptr) << "Value ptr cannot be NULL";
781  }
782  memcpy(buffer, v.ptr, type_length_);
783  buffer += type_length_;
784  }
785 }
786 
787 template <typename DType>
788 inline int DictEncoder<DType>::WriteIndices(uint8_t* buffer, int buffer_len) {
789  // Write bit width in first byte
790  *buffer = static_cast<uint8_t>(bit_width());
791  ++buffer;
792  --buffer_len;
793 
794  ::arrow::util::RleEncoder encoder(buffer, buffer_len, bit_width());
795  for (int index : buffered_indices_) {
796  if (!encoder.Put(index)) return -1;
797  }
798  encoder.Flush();
799 
800  ClearIndices();
801  return 1 + encoder.len();
802 }
803 
804 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
805 // DeltaBitPackDecoder
806 
807 template <typename DType>
808 class DeltaBitPackDecoder : public Decoder<DType> {
809  public:
810  typedef typename DType::c_type T;
811 
812  explicit DeltaBitPackDecoder(const ColumnDescriptor* descr,
813  ::arrow::MemoryPool* pool = ::arrow::default_memory_pool())
814  : Decoder<DType>(descr, Encoding::DELTA_BINARY_PACKED), pool_(pool) {
815  if (DType::type_num != Type::INT32 && DType::type_num != Type::INT64) {
816  throw ParquetException("Delta bit pack encoding should only be for integer data.");
817  }
818  }
819 
820  virtual void SetData(int num_values, const uint8_t* data, int len) {
821  num_values_ = num_values;
822  decoder_ = BitUtil::BitReader(data, len);
823  values_current_block_ = 0;
824  values_current_mini_block_ = 0;
825  }
826 
827  virtual int Decode(T* buffer, int max_values) {
828  return GetInternal(buffer, max_values);
829  }
830 
831  private:
832  using Decoder<DType>::num_values_;
833 
834  void InitBlock() {
835  int32_t block_size;
836  if (!decoder_.GetVlqInt(&block_size)) ParquetException::EofException();
837  if (!decoder_.GetVlqInt(&num_mini_blocks_)) ParquetException::EofException();
838  if (!decoder_.GetVlqInt(&values_current_block_)) {
839  ParquetException::EofException();
840  }
841  if (!decoder_.GetZigZagVlqInt(&last_value_)) ParquetException::EofException();
842 
843  delta_bit_widths_ = AllocateBuffer(pool_, num_mini_blocks_);
844  uint8_t* bit_width_data = delta_bit_widths_->mutable_data();
845 
846  if (!decoder_.GetZigZagVlqInt(&min_delta_)) ParquetException::EofException();
847  for (int i = 0; i < num_mini_blocks_; ++i) {
848  if (!decoder_.GetAligned<uint8_t>(1, bit_width_data + i)) {
849  ParquetException::EofException();
850  }
851  }
852  values_per_mini_block_ = block_size / num_mini_blocks_;
853  mini_block_idx_ = 0;
854  delta_bit_width_ = bit_width_data[0];
855  values_current_mini_block_ = values_per_mini_block_;
856  }
857 
858  template <typename T>
859  int GetInternal(T* buffer, int max_values) {
860  max_values = std::min(max_values, num_values_);
861  const uint8_t* bit_width_data = delta_bit_widths_->data();
862  for (int i = 0; i < max_values; ++i) {
863  if (ARROW_PREDICT_FALSE(values_current_mini_block_ == 0)) {
864  ++mini_block_idx_;
865  if (mini_block_idx_ < static_cast<size_t>(delta_bit_widths_->size())) {
866  delta_bit_width_ = bit_width_data[mini_block_idx_];
867  values_current_mini_block_ = values_per_mini_block_;
868  } else {
869  InitBlock();
870  buffer[i] = last_value_;
871  continue;
872  }
873  }
874 
875  // TODO: the key to this algorithm is to decode the entire miniblock at once.
876  int64_t delta;
877  if (!decoder_.GetValue(delta_bit_width_, &delta)) ParquetException::EofException();
878  delta += min_delta_;
879  last_value_ += static_cast<int32_t>(delta);
880  buffer[i] = last_value_;
881  --values_current_mini_block_;
882  }
883  num_values_ -= max_values;
884  return max_values;
885  }
886 
887  ::arrow::MemoryPool* pool_;
888  BitUtil::BitReader decoder_;
889  int32_t values_current_block_;
890  int32_t num_mini_blocks_;
891  uint64_t values_per_mini_block_;
892  uint64_t values_current_mini_block_;
893 
894  int32_t min_delta_;
895  size_t mini_block_idx_;
896  std::shared_ptr<ResizableBuffer> delta_bit_widths_;
897  int delta_bit_width_;
898 
899  int32_t last_value_;
900 };
901 
902 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
903 // DELTA_LENGTH_BYTE_ARRAY
904 
905 class DeltaLengthByteArrayDecoder : public Decoder<ByteArrayType> {
906  public:
907  explicit DeltaLengthByteArrayDecoder(
908  const ColumnDescriptor* descr,
909  ::arrow::MemoryPool* pool = ::arrow::default_memory_pool())
910  : Decoder<ByteArrayType>(descr, Encoding::DELTA_LENGTH_BYTE_ARRAY),
911  len_decoder_(nullptr, pool) {}
912 
913  virtual void SetData(int num_values, const uint8_t* data, int len) {
914  num_values_ = num_values;
915  if (len == 0) return;
916  int total_lengths_len = *reinterpret_cast<const int*>(data);
917  data += 4;
918  len_decoder_.SetData(num_values, data, total_lengths_len);
919  data_ = data + total_lengths_len;
920  len_ = len - 4 - total_lengths_len;
921  }
922 
923  virtual int Decode(ByteArray* buffer, int max_values) {
924  max_values = std::min(max_values, num_values_);
925  std::vector<int> lengths(max_values);
926  len_decoder_.Decode(lengths.data(), max_values);
927  for (int i = 0; i < max_values; ++i) {
928  buffer[i].len = lengths[i];
929  buffer[i].ptr = data_;
930  data_ += lengths[i];
931  len_ -= lengths[i];
932  }
933  num_values_ -= max_values;
934  return max_values;
935  }
936 
937  private:
938  using Decoder<ByteArrayType>::num_values_;
939  DeltaBitPackDecoder<Int32Type> len_decoder_;
940  const uint8_t* data_;
941  int len_;
942 };
943 
944 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
945 // DELTA_BYTE_ARRAY
946 
947 class DeltaByteArrayDecoder : public Decoder<ByteArrayType> {
948  public:
949  explicit DeltaByteArrayDecoder(
950  const ColumnDescriptor* descr,
951  ::arrow::MemoryPool* pool = ::arrow::default_memory_pool())
952  : Decoder<ByteArrayType>(descr, Encoding::DELTA_BYTE_ARRAY),
953  prefix_len_decoder_(nullptr, pool),
954  suffix_decoder_(nullptr, pool),
955  last_value_(0, nullptr) {}
956 
957  virtual void SetData(int num_values, const uint8_t* data, int len) {
958  num_values_ = num_values;
959  if (len == 0) return;
960  int prefix_len_length = *reinterpret_cast<const int*>(data);
961  data += 4;
962  len -= 4;
963  prefix_len_decoder_.SetData(num_values, data, prefix_len_length);
964  data += prefix_len_length;
965  len -= prefix_len_length;
966  suffix_decoder_.SetData(num_values, data, len);
967  }
968 
969  // TODO: this doesn't work and requires memory management. We need to allocate
970  // new strings to store the results.
971  virtual int Decode(ByteArray* buffer, int max_values) {
972  max_values = std::min(max_values, num_values_);
973  for (int i = 0; i < max_values; ++i) {
974  int prefix_len = 0;
975  prefix_len_decoder_.Decode(&prefix_len, 1);
976  ByteArray suffix = {0, nullptr};
977  suffix_decoder_.Decode(&suffix, 1);
978  buffer[i].len = prefix_len + suffix.len;
979 
980  uint8_t* result = reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(malloc(buffer[i].len));
981  memcpy(result, last_value_.ptr, prefix_len);
982  memcpy(result + prefix_len, suffix.ptr, suffix.len);
983 
984  buffer[i].ptr = result;
985  last_value_ = buffer[i];
986  }
987  num_values_ -= max_values;
988  return max_values;
989  }
990 
991  private:
992  using Decoder<ByteArrayType>::num_values_;
993 
994  DeltaBitPackDecoder<Int32Type> prefix_len_decoder_;
995  DeltaLengthByteArrayDecoder suffix_decoder_;
996  ByteArray last_value_;
997 };
